text: <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ligation induces nuclear factor-kappa B activation in human T cell lines .
<extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is a recently described member of the tumor necrosis factor / nerve growth factor receptor superfamily .

In this report , we show that following incubation of L540 cells ( Hodgkin 's disease - derived , T cell-like , <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + cells ) with the agonistic anti - <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> monoclonal antibodies ( mAb ) M44 and M67 , two nuclear factor ( NF ) - kappa B DNA binding activities were induced in nuclear extracts , as determined in gel retardation assays .

The effect of the mAb towards NF-kappa B activation was rapid , as it occurred within 20 min , and was sustained for up to 6 h . By comparison , an isotype-matched antibody had no effect on NF-kappa B activation .

Moreover , in human T helper ( Th ) clones functionally characterized as being of the type 0 , type 1 and type 2 ( 28 % , < 1 % und 93 % CD30+ , respectively ) , the extent of <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated NF-kappa B activation correlated with the proportion of <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + cells .

In all cell lines investigated , the NF-kappa B complexes induced following <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> engagement were shown to contain <extra_id_0> p50 NF-kappa B1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> p65 RelA <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and possibly other transcription factors .

Collectively , our results demonstrate that nuclear translocation and activation of NF-kappa B rank among the short-term cellular responses elicited following <extra_id_0> CD30 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ligation .
